cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the southeastern Gulf today, then turning northwest toward the Texas–Louisiana coast mid-week and tracking inland toward Arkansas and the lower Mississippi/Tennessee valleys late week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (between Port Bolivar TX and Morgan City LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Port Bolivar TX to west of Morgan City LA; Storm Surge Watch San Luis Pass TX to Ocean Springs MS including nearby bays and lakes
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for western Cuba, Lower Florida Keys and Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact expected along the central-western Gulf Coast, especially Texas–Louisiana shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture may bring 1–3 inches of rain to portions of Illinois late Friday into Saturday, locally higher in thunderstorms.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river rises and localized flooding possible along the Illinois River channels near the port.
